poem:
### Office of the Future

Steel veins and glass skins,  
where introverts nest in quiet corners,  
extroverts soar through lobbies loud,  
cycling to their sky-high dreams.  
A garden grows in winter's clutch,  
roots tangled with time's whispers,  
betting on the return of bodies and buzz,  
where work and wonder intertwine.
